featured.text: De Mestral thus began mass-producing Velcro, opening plants in Europe and eventually into Canada and the United States.
Named “Velcro,” from the French words velours (velvet) and crochet (hook), the new product received a patent from the Swiss government in 1955.
As most fashion critics considered it ugly and cheap-looking, the use of Velcro was limited to athletic equipment.

other.text: Which of the following fields is NOT mentioned for Velcro uses in the passage? (A) Civil engineering.
Initially Velcro did not fare well.
Which of the following statements about Velcro is true?

definition.zh_def: 一種由兩種不同材料組成的黏合帶，通常用於快速固定或連接物品。
definition.en_def: A type of fastener consisting of two strips of fabric, one with tiny hooks and the other with loops, used for quickly fastening or connecting items.
definition.example: I used Velcro to attach the patches to my backpack.
